name: Phase Shifter
description: This algorithm is based on the Phase Shifter algorithm from the disting mk4. It generates two outputs with a fixed phase relationship between them, designed for mathematical accuracy rather than just creating swooshy sounds like the Phaser algorithm. While primarily intended for precise psycho-acoustic effects, it can also produce interesting sweeping sounds.
use_cases: Creating sweeping or phasing sound textures

input_ports.name: Shift input
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the phase shift CV, scaled as 5V per 360Â°.

input_ports.name: Input
input_ports.description: The first audio input bus (ranges from 1 to 28).

output_ports.name: Unshifted output
output_ports.description: The bus for the unshifted output signal. This is not the same as dry signal unless the input is a pure sine wave.

output_ports.name: +ve shift output
output_ports.description: The bus for the positive phase-shifted output signal.

output_ports.name: -ve shift output
output_ports.description: The bus for the negative phase-shifted output signal.
